business.headline: US, India seal trade deal after PM-Trump call: 5 things that changed overnightInstead of leaving the details to official statements, US President Donald Trump chose to spell out the trade deal himself, framing it as a result of personal diplomacy and immediate action.

Trump announces India trade deal, cuts tariffs to 18% after call with PM Modi Live Updates Also shedding light on the much-awaited US-India trade deal, which had faced several roadblocks with New Delhi adamant about not opening its agriculture sector to Washington, Trump said that an agreement is finally on the cards. Trump said he lowered the reciprocal tariffs following discussions with PM Modi, describing the move as a gesture of "friendship and respect."

Budget 2026: 7 key takeaways for individual taxpayersThe Union Budget 2026 may not have changed income tax rates, but it brings several practical updates that affect how individuals file returns, disclose income and deal with compliance. From easier timelines to simpler rules, here are the key takeaways taxpayers should know.

Silver ETF takes a hit: Down Rs 2 lakh, what should investors do now?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), silver prices have dropped sharply from their record peak, while gold has also seen a strong correction.

Silver prices crash Rs 17,000 today. More correction ahead?After touching record highs in recent weeks, silver prices have cooled sharply. The metal has slipped by nearly Rs 17,000, prompting investors to pause and reassess whether this fall is a buying opportunity or a sign to stay cautious.
Sensex ends 944 points higher: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 943.52 points to close at 81,666.46, while the NSE Nifty50 added 262.95 points to end at 25,088.40.

From stronger banks to easier credit: Who stands to gain from Budget 2026?A key announcement in the Budget was the proposal to set up a High-Level Committee on Banking for Viksit Bharat. The committee will undertake a comprehensive review of the sector and suggest reforms to align it with India's next stage of economic growth.
Nithin Kamath says STT hike won't curb F&O trade. Here's whyIn the Union Budget 2026, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced an increase in STT on futures and options trades.

Cigarettes to cost more now: Check the latest pricesSmokers are now paying more at the counter. From February 1, cigarette prices have gone up following a fresh tax hike, marking the first increase in nearly seven years.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall. Should you buy now?Gold and silver prices have tumbled sharply over the past few days. Read on to know the reason behind the rapid decline, and whether investors should buy or wait for further correction.

Why the government raised STT, making F&O trading more expensiveFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear in her Budget speech that the Securities Transaction Tax, or STT, will go up for derivatives trades from April 1, 2026.

Why LTCG tax is back in the spotlight after Budget 2026After Budget 2026, long-term capital gains have emerged as a key talking point among investors and market watchers alike. So why is LTCG suddenly being discussed everywhere?

Gold, silver extend losses today: Check latest MCX rates and city-wise pricesIn India, the correction in global prices has filtered into domestic bullion markets as well. Gold was priced at Rs 143,460 per 10 grams, down by Rs 4,780 or 3.22% as of 9:55 am.
Sensex, Nifty open flat but surge ahead a few minutes into early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 161.62 points to 80,884.56, while the NSE Nifty50 added 9.80 points to 24,835.25 as of 9:28 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market crash again?Gift Nifty futures (GIFc1) were trading at 24,869.5 points at around 8:00 am. This suggests that the benchmark Nifty 50 index may open close to Sunday's closing level of 24,825.45.

Budget 2026: Will your Sovereign Gold Bond gains face higher tax?The tax benefit still exists, but it is now available only in a specific situation. Earlier, individual investors did not have to pay any capital gains tax if they held a Sovereign Gold Bond till maturity, but after the Budget 2026 announcement that has changed.

Big vision, tight margins: Why execution will make or break this BudgetThe direction for Budget 2026 is right, but delivery will decide credibility. In that sense, this is a Budget that excites on paper while simultaneously inviting scrutiny on execution.
Parliament gets Rs 1,492 crore in Budget 2026Parliament has been allocated Rs 1,492 crore in the Union Budget 2026 presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman today.

Macro stability is not to be sniffed at: Sanjeev Sanyal calls Budget 2026 solid, no-nonsenseEconomist and PM's Economic Advisory Council member Sanjeev Sanyal has described the Union Budget 2026 as a "solid, no-nonsense" exercise, arguing that fiscal consolidation and macro stability are its core strengths. He rejected the notion that the absence of "big-bang" announcements made the budget underwhelming.

Govt raises duty-free goods import limit to Rs 75,000 under new baggage rulesA tourist of foreign origin, not being an infant, arriving in India, shall be allowed duty-free clearance of articles up to the value of Rs 25,000. This limit was Rs 15,000 under the Baggage Rules, 2016.

entertainment.headline: Timothee Chalamet gets shy while reacting to marriage question: That's so personal Timothee Chalamet playfully dodged questions about marriage during a Marty Supreme Q&A in London, charming fans with his humorous responses.

Jana Nayagan delay: Tamil Nadu theatres face Rs 100 crore loss, survival crisis Jana Nayagan's indefinite delay has resulted in a massive financial loss for Tamil Nadu theatres. The industry now faces a survival crisis as single-screen theatres risk closure amid ongoing legal and political uncertainties.

Zendaya, Robert Pattinson's new poster for The Drama ignites dangerous chemistry Zendaya and Robert Pattinson have set the internet abuzz after A24 unveiled a wedding-themed poster for The Drama, teasing the film's intense and unsettling tone ahead of its trailer release.

Shriya Saran on 25 years in films: A woman's work is always questioned Shriya Saran opened up about the constant pressure on women to prove themselves, the anxiety that comes with the creative process, and the need for strong support systems.

Love Story trailer revisits John F Kennedy Jr and Carolyn Bessette's romance The new trailer for Love Story offers a look at the romance between John F Kennedy Jr and Carolyn Bessette, focusing on the challenges of fame, identity, and loss, as portrayed in Ryan Murphy's anthology series.

Tales From '85: Hawkins freezes over as new threat emerges in series teaser Stranger Things expands its universe with the animated spin-off Tales From '85, premiering on April 23 on Netflix. Set in winter 1985, the series promises new mysteries and familiar characters, blending suspense with a fresh animated style.

Kim Kardashian-Lewis Hamilton's secret date night in UK sparks dating buzz: Report As per reports, Kim Kardashian and F1 driver Lewis Hamilton spent a discreet weekend together at Estelle Manor in the Cotswolds, avoiding public attention. Their recent outing has sparked romance rumours.

Michael trailer promises an intimate look at Michael Jackson's legacy. Watch here Jaafar Jackson stars as his uncle in Antoine Fuqua's new film Michael, chronicling the artist's rise, with a release date set for April 24. The trailer was revealed on Monday.

Congrats Grammy: Kamal Haasan reacts after the Dalai Lama's historic win Veteran actor Kamal Haasan congratulated Dalai Lama on receiving his first Grammy award at 91 for his collaborative spoken word album.

Dulquer Salmaan, Mrunal Thakur reunite for AR Rahman's new song Bheegi Bheegi Actor Dulquer Salmaan and Mrunal Thakur reunite in the evocative music video Bheegi Bheegi, composed by AR Rahman and released on February 2, 2026. The song beautifully blends retro and futuristic visuals, capturing emotional depth through a unique narrative of parallel realities.

Anaswara slams out of context headline over With Love interview remark Anaswara responded to a headline which took one of her light-hearted remarks from a Tamil interview out of context, while promoting With Love, stating her words were used to create unnecessary controversy.

Maxtern revisits Elvish Yadav row on The 50, claims he sent Rs 1 lakh before clash Contestant Maxtern discussed his past conflict with Elvish Yadav during a conversation on The 50, sharing claims about a money transfer and the aftermath of their widely publicised altercation. The 50 premiered on February 1.

Shahid Kapoor's O' Romeo in legal crossfire, Ustara's daughter seeks stay Shahid Kapoor's O' Romeo faces legal trouble days before release. A suit seeking to restrain release has been filed by Sanober Shaikh, daughter of gangster Hussain Ustara, alleging O' Romeo portrays his life falsely.

D55: Sai Pallavi joins Dhanush, Sreeleela in director Rajkumar Periasamy's film Sai Pallavi has officially been announced as a cast member in D55, the upcoming Tamil film starring Dhanush and directed by Rajkumar Periasamy.

Sanjay Mishra says being typecast as comic relief is irritating but gives him work Sanjay Mishra recently expressed his frustration over being pigeonholed as a comic actor in Bollywood. Comparing himself to a kitchen spice, he noted that while producers rely on his "one-take" comedy skills, the constant stereotyping can often become quite irritating for him.

Dhurandhar 2: Ranveer Singh, Sara Arjun, Aditya Dhar post cryptic 12:12 update Actor Ranveer Singh, along with co-star Sara Arjun and director Aditya Dhar, shared a cryptic post on Dhurandhar 2's first glimpse. The much-anticipated sequel is slated to release on March 19.

Javed Akhtar roasts Farah Khan for asking what 'ektalis' means Farah Khan's recent visit to the home of Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi for her cooking vlog led to light-hearted moments, including jokes about counting in Hindi and playful exchanges with both hosts.

Dhurandhar's most chilling theory divides internet: What truly happened at wedding? A key wedding scene in Dhurandhar has sparked intense debate online, with viewers questioning whether Ranveer Singh's Hamza truly failed, or made a calculated choice. It might make you question if you know Dhurandhar enough.

Anurag Sinha on working with 'senior' Emraan Hashmi in Taskaree: No baggage Anurag Sinha steps into a darker character in the Netflix series Taskaree. In an exclusive interview, the actor spoke about sharing screen space with co-star Emraan Hashmi, tapping on a negative role and whether he'd be open to doing commercial Bollywood projects.

general news.headline: Trump announces India trade deal, cuts tariffs to 18% after call with PM Modi Live Updates Also shedding light on the much-awaited US-India trade deal, which had faced several roadblocks with New Delhi adamant about not opening its agriculture sector to Washington, Trump said that an agreement is finally on the cards. Trump said he lowered the reciprocal tariffs following discussions with PM Modi, describing the move as a gesture of "friendship and respect."

India gains tariff advantage over China, Pak, Bangladesh in US trade dealThe 50 per cent US levy included a 25 per cent reciprocal tariff and an additional 25 per cent import duty imposed over India's purchase of Russian crude oil. With the new deal, Washington has removed the extra penalty and lowered the overall rate.

Zero tariffs for US goods? Explaining India's big trade promise in Trump dealIf carried out, the move would mark a significant shift in India's long-standing trade approach, which has traditionally depended on protective measures to support domestic industries. It could open the door wider to US agricultural goods, energy supplies and manufactured products.

Dhurandhar 2: Ranveer Singh, Sara Arjun, Aditya Dhar post cryptic 12:12 updateActor Ranveer Singh, along with co-star Sara Arjun and director Aditya Dhar, shared a cryptic post on Dhurandhar 2's first glimpse. The much-anticipated sequel is slated to release on March 19.

Why Baloch women are taking up arms, raining death on Pak forcesBaloch women fighters played a key role in the BLA's recent coordinated attacks across Balochistan. The involvement of women in the Baloch armed movement is part of the broader trend. After peaceful protests over enforced disappearances and exploitations failed, with men jailed or killed, the once-silent Baloch women are picking up arms, and even turning suicide bombers.

India-US trade deal live: Legal text of agreement still being finalisedUS-India Trade Deal Live Updates: US President Donald Trump has announced a cut in tariffs on Indian goods from 25 per cent to 18 per cent after speaking with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, signalling an easing of strained ties. PM Modi welcomed the move, saying "Made in India" products would now face lower tariffs and thanked Trump for the decision. The US President said the cut followed PM's request and reflected friendship and respect. Trump also said a long-pending India-US trade deal is now close, despite earlier disagreements, especially over agriculture. He added that PM had agreed to reduce purchases of Russian oil and shift imports towards the US and Venezuela. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

US, India seal trade deal after PM-Trump call: 5 things that changed overnightInstead of leaving the details to official statements, US President Donald Trump chose to spell out the trade deal himself, framing it as a result of personal diplomacy and immediate action.

Meet Padma Shri Anke Gowda, the bus conductor behind India's largest free libraryAnke Gowda, a 75-year-old Padma Shri awardee from Karnataka, has spent over five decades building one of India's largest free-access libraries. From humble beginnings as a bus conductor, he devoted his earnings and life to collecting books and promoting literacy in a rural setting through his library, Pustaka Mane.

Thick fog engulfs Delhi-NCR as mercury dips again, airport warns of flight delaysThe cold spell intensified on Monday, when Delhi recorded its coldest February day in four years. Dense fog blanketed several parts of the city during the early hours, sharply reducing visibility and deepening the chill.

Trump uses India Today cover image of Modi and self to indicate all's well againThe social media post on Truth Social carried no accompanying text, triggering widespread speculation. Trump shared the cover of India Today magazine's "Newsmakers of the Year 2025" edition, featuring Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi alongside Trump.

Trump shares picture of India Gate, then gives a messageThe post comes against the backdrop of Trump's plan to build a colossal new triumphal arch in the US capital to celebrate the 250th anniversary of American independence, which falls this year.

Clintons to testify in Epstein probe, slam US Congress panel's 'bad faith' tacticsFormer US President Bill Clinton's name has appeared in the latest batch of files released by the Department of Justice in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. Clinton has firmly denied any wrongdoing and has said he had no knowledge of Epstein's sex crimes. Reports have also noted that he has never been accused by Epstein's survivors.

Jana Nayagan delay: Tamil Nadu theatres face Rs 100 crore loss, survival crisisJana Nayagan's indefinite delay has resulted in a massive financial loss for Tamil Nadu theatres. The industry now faces a survival crisis as single-screen theatres risk closure amid ongoing legal and political uncertainties.

PM's big thanks to Trump after tariff cut: Unlocks immense opportunitiesPrime Minister Narendra Modi said that he had a "wonderful" conversation with US President Donald Trump, welcoming the decision to reduce tariffs on Made in India products to 18 percent.

Water instead of fuel in China's nuclear missiles led to Xi's military purge?The fall of Zhang Youxi, China's top uniformed military officer, in President Xi Jinping's purge might have to do with corruption, espionage and the PLA's operational readiness. Chinese missiles were found to have been filled with water instead of fuel, which led to the removal of the PLA Rocket Force's leadership in 2023 and 2024. Zhang is said to have passed on China's nuclear secrets to the US, and could be linked to the Rocket Force purge.

Trump-nirbharta: Congress's dig at PM after US President announces trade dealThe Congress attacked the government after the US announced a trade deal with India following a Trump-Modi phone call, saying key developments were revealed by the American side first. While PM Modi later welcomed the tariff cut on Indian goods to 18%, the opposition accused the Centre of "Trump-nirbharta" in foreign policy communication.

Why did Ronaldo not play in Al Nassr vs Al Riyadh? Controversy explainedCristiano Ronaldo's unexplained absence from Al Nassr's league clash has ignited strike rumours and exposed growing tensions behind the scenes. At stake is not fitness, but power, ambition, and his future in Saudi football itself.

Why ex-Army Chief Naravane's book is at centre of Rahul Gandhi-govt face-offAn unpublished book by former Army chief General MM Naravane has led to the Lok Sabha being adjourned as Leader of the Opposition, Rahul Gandhi, repeatedly tried to read out excerpts from an article on it. This is what Naravane's memoir, Four Stars of Destiny, is about, and why it hasn't been published yet.

Zendaya, Robert Pattinson's new poster for The Drama ignites dangerous chemistryZendaya and Robert Pattinson have set the internet abuzz after A24 unveiled a wedding-themed poster for The Drama, teasing the film's intense and unsettling tone ahead of its trailer release.

Final US tariffs to be 18%, technical issues remain, Sergio Gor tells India TodaySpeaking to India Today, Sergio Gor said he had played no direct role in the negotiations, crediting Donald Trump and Narendra Modi for driving the agreement forward through their strong personal relationship. He added that the final tariff rate will be set at 18 per cent.

Singapore remains a top pick for Indians, but flying there just got tougherSingapore has been one of the most popular destinations on the Indian traveller's bucket list. And now there's a new law for entering the 'City in a Garden.' Scroll down to be well-informed before your trip to Singapore.

Why the big-bang India-EU FTA has rattled both Pakistan and BangladeshExporters in both Pakistan and Bangladesh have warned that the India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) could erode their hard-won advantages in the lucrative European market as Indian goods gain duty-free access. Hinting at India's Operation Sindoor, an official of a Pakistani traders' association said that Delhi had "opened an economic front" against Islamabad.

Fuel switch scare on London-Bengaluru Air India flight, airline grounds DreamlinerIn a statement, Air India said the matter has been communicated to the aviation regulator, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA). It added that following a DGCA directive, fuel control switches on all Boeing 787 aircraft in its fleet were inspected, and no issues were found.

After icy chills, western disturbance to bring rains on TuesdayThe IMD said the weather system is likely to cause scattered rainfall and snowfall across the Western Himalayan region, including Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand.

sports.headline: ISL picks FanCode over JioHotstar: Value drops from Rs 1.68 cr to Rs 9.5 lakh FanCode has announced as the new broadcast partner of the Indian Super League after beating JioStar in the bidding war. The deal finally clears the way for the delayed ISL season to restart on February 14.

Pakistan pulling off a drama with India boycott in T20 World Cup: Harbhajan Harbhajan Singh has torn into Pakistan's India-match boycott call, calling it staged drama. The former spinner challenged the PCB to hold its nerve and avoid another familiar U-turn at the T20 World Cup.

Why did Ronaldo not play in Al Nassr vs Al Riyadh? Controversy explained Cristiano Ronaldo's unexplained absence from Al Nassr's league clash has ignited strike rumours and exposed growing tensions behind the scenes. At stake is not fitness, but power, ambition, and his future in Saudi football itself.

Legal or illegal? Indian umpire gives verdict on Usman Tariq's bowling action Former umpire Anil Chaudhary has declared Usman Tariq's bowling action legal after scrutiny in the Australia series. The decision comes amid debates sparked by Cameron Green's on-field gestures and previous suspicions in the Pakistan Super League.

Sri Lanka back Kamindu Mendis for T20 World Cup, Dhananjaya de Silva dropped from squad Sri Lanka have recalled Kamindu Mendis to their T20 World Cup squad despite his modest returns in the format, while the co-hosts have opted to leave out veteran all-rounder Dhananjaya de Silva.

USA send T20 World Cup warning with strong show against India A in warm-up game USA delivered a strong performance against India A in the T20 World Cup 2026 warm-up match. Tilak Varma's fitness return and Ravi Bishnoi's performance were the major positives for India in the fixture.

IND vs NZ: KCA acts on inflated water prices during Thiruvananthapuram T20I Kerala Cricket Association has launched an investigation into inflated water prices for fans during the India vs New Zealand fifth T20I in Thiruvananthapuram. Several videos and posts circulating on social media showed spectators being charged above the permitted rates at certain sections of the Greenfield International stadium.

AUS vs ENG, U19 World Cup semi-final Live Streaming: When and where to watch U19 World Cup: Australia and England are all set to face each other in the first semi-final of the tournament on Tuesday, February 3 in Bulawayo. Both teams are unbeaten, having won all their five matches.

Carlos Alcaraz withdraws from Rotterdam Open hours after maiden Australian Open title Carlos Alcaraz withdrew from the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam on Monday, just hours after clinching his maiden Australian Open title. The Spaniard, who lifted the trophy at the ATP 500 event last season, will not return to defend his crown at the indoor hard-court tournament.

No India-Pakistan game in T20 World Cup may cause USD 250 million losses to ICC No India-Pakistan match in the T20 World Cup 2026, scheduled to be played in Colombo, could cause significant financial losses to ICC to the tune of USD 250 million, according to estimates. The Pakistan government has asked its team not to participate in the India fixture but play the entire tournament.

BCCI's handling of Mustafizur saga sparked T20 World Cup crisis: ex-ICC official Former International Cricket Council (ICC) Head of Communications Sami-ul-Hasan Burney on Monday said the BCCI could have avoided the current T20 World Cup turmoil by handling Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit with greater discretion.

Umpiring blunder? Pakistan keeper makes foolish stumping error, but gets luckyPakistan wicketkeeper Khawaja Nafay made a controversial stumping to dismiss Cooper Connolly off Mohammad Nawaz. On Sunday, Pakistan beat Australia by 111 runs to sweep the T20I series 3-0.

T20 World Cup warm-up: Tilak Varma's brisk 38 sparks hopes of swift comebackTilak Varma returned to competitive cricket after recovering from an abdominal injury. His strong performance raises hopes for India in the upcoming T20 World Cup but sparks selection challenges.

Meg Lanning, fuelled with fire, confirms WPL 2027 return after horror seasonMeg Lanning has confirmed her return to the Women's Premier League in 2027 after a difficult season with UP Warriorz. Her comeback signals a strong desire to compete and lead despite recent challenges.

Mary Kom apologises for 'didn't earn a single rupee' dig at ex-husband OnlerIndian boxing icon Mary Kom has issued a public apology after her remarks about ex-husband K Onler Kom on a television chat show sparked backlash on social media. The comments were made during an emotional discussion about her personal life and have kept the six-time world champion in the spotlight in recent weeks.

Is Mohsin Naqvi now cricket's troublemaker-in-chief?From handshake rows to World Cup boycotts, Mohsin Naqvi has kept cricket on edge. His confrontations with India have turned administration into spectacle, dragging the game into politics instead of letting it breathe.

Pakistan travel to Sri Lanka for T20 World Cup 2026 amid India boycott stancePakistan cricket team has left for Sri Lanka to participate in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 after their government denied them permission to play against India. This boycott raises concerns from the ICC and may affect Pakistan's cricketing future globally.

Suspicious or just strange? Parthiv Patel baffled by Pakistan U19's tactics vs IndiaU19 World Cup: Parthiv Patel said that he was surprised with Pakistan's approach and their lack of intent to qualify for the semis when they played in the Super 6 clash against India on Sunday.

ICC can't punish Pakistan for boycotting India at T20 World Cup: Ex-chairmanFormer International Cricket Council chairman Ehsan Mani has said the ICC cannot punish Pakistan for boycotting its marquee ICC Men's T20 World Cup group-stage match against India, arguing that the decision was taken on government instructions and therefore leaves little scope for sanctions.

Babar Azam breaks Virat Kohli's record, bounces back to form ahead of T20 World CupBabar Azam broke Virat Kohli's record for most T20I fifties as Pakistan dominated Australia in a 3-0 series whitewash. Pakistan have warmed up in style for the upcoming T20 World Cup by defeating Australia.

India batter reveals dark side of facing hate, trolls over her looksWPL 2026: India Women's batter Bharti Fulmali has spoken candidly about enduring online hate and trolling over her looks, admitting the mental toll it has taken over the last three years.

Will F1 return to India? Efforts underway to bring race back to Buddh circuitThe Indian government is actively working to bring back the Formula 1 Grand Prix to the Buddh International Circuit after more than 10 years. Efforts focus on resolving tax and regulatory issues that previously caused the event's cancellation, signalling a potential revival in the near future.

ICC right to warn Pakistan over India boycott in T20 World Cup: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has supported the ICC's decision to warn Pakistan of severe repercussions for its selective pullout from the high-profile T20 World Cup clash against India in Colombo on February 15.

Watch out for Anahat at LA Olympics: India proud as squash star wins major titleParth Jindal, founder of JSW Sports, hailed Anahat Singh's maiden PSA Bronze-level title and said the entire nation should keep an eye on the young squash star at the 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles.

ICC announces T20 World Cup warm-up match fixtures, livestreaming detailsT20 World Cup 2026: A total of 16 warm-up matches will be played between February 2 and 6 across four venues in India and Sri Lanka. While Suryakumar Yadav-led India will take on South Africa on February 4, India A, led by Ayush Badoni, will play two warm-up matches.

T20 World Cup: Fit-again Tilak Varma included in India A squad for warm-upsTilak Varma returns to action as India include him in the India A warm-ups, marking his final fitness test before the T20 World Cup. The two matches will decide how soon he rejoins the senior side.

Carlos Alcaraz plans kangaroo tattoo to celebrate his Australian Open title winFresh off a career-defining triumph, Carlos Alcaraz is considering a permanent reminder of his Australian Open glory in the form of a small kangaroo tattoo.

No win, no learn: Pak's selective boycott is a masterclass in hypocrisyT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan's selective boycott of the India match isn't principle but panic. It is a tantrum that mocks history, hurts its cricket, and leaves Islamabad howling alone while the world plays on.

Batting great backs Pak's India boycott, alleges selective influence in ICCPakistan's boycott of the India clash has sparked fresh debate across world cricket. Backed by Mohammad Yousaf, the move is being pitched as a stand against selective influence, not just a one-off protest.

ICC may call board meet on Pakistan boycott threat, severe sanctions likelyThe ICC is set to meet soon to discuss Pakistan's threat to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India. On Sunday, the global body warned Pakistan of the possible implications and urged the Pakistan Cricket Board to take a decision in the best interests of global cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
